column4: n00b here...I dl'ed americas army, and I installed it but nothing happens when I try to execute it
could someone please help me locate the error?
someone, please?
cope: it's not an exe... I installed it even
It created a folder called armyops in /home/roffe/ and in there there's a file called armyops, but it won't execute... 2.5 yeas
you can't have a directory and file by the same name in the same directory
maybe you need to do this .. chmod +x ~/armyops/armyops; ~/armyops/armyops
maybe you need to do this .. chmod +x ~/armyops/armyops; ~/armyops/armyops
what is the full pathname of that file?
what happens when you type just this then?  /home/roffe/armyops/armyops
try this command first.. sudo aptitude install build-essential
ok, you should have gotten rid of this error once that is done
your executable needed a shared library that was missing
if everything is working now, you should be ok.
you might want to install links ..
its a cli web browser
for whatever it is that the thing is trying to install
it might be trying to download a file from a server and needs links inorder to do so
maybe .. sudo aptitude install links
all you need to do is make sense of the error messages you get
/usr/bin/xterm: Can't execvp links: No such file or directory < tells you that xterm has spit out a message saying it can't execute something called 'links' ..
